Package net.jhoogland.jautomata

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Automaton<L,K>
    All automata (acceptors, transducers, multi-tape automata, and their weighted variants) implement this interface.
    MTAutomaton<T,L,K>
    Multi-tape automaton types must implement this interface.
    MTLabel<T,L>
    The label type of multi-tape automata.
    ReverselyAccessibleAutomaton<L,K>
    Automata classes that implement this interface provide methods to iterate over an automaton in the reverse direction, starting at the final states via incoming transitions.
    SingleSourceShortestDistancesInterface<K>
    Implemented by single source shortest distance algorithms.
    Transducer<I,O,K>
    A convenience interface that is optionally implemented by transducers.
    WeightConvergenceCondition<K>
    Implementations of this interface define weight convergence conditions.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AbstractAutomaton<L,K>
    Abstract class that implements the semiring() and topologicalOrder() methods of the Automaton interface.
    ApproximateConvergence
    Weight convergence condition for Double values that yields true if and only if the previous and current weights are approximately the same, i.e. the difference is within a specified bound.
    ArrayAutomaton<L,K>
    Implementation of Automaton that is backed up by arrays of states and transitions.
    ArrayMTLabel<L>
    Implementation of a multi-tape label type.
    Automata
    This class contains static methods for computing properties of automata, creating various types of automata, and performing weight computations on automata.
    BasicState<K>
    Instances of this class contain information of a state, such as initial weight, final weight, and outgoing and incoming transitions.
    BasicTransition<L,K>
    Instances of this class contain information of a transition, such as previous and next state, label, and weight.
    EditableAutomaton<L,K>
    An automaton type that can be edited using the addState and addTransition methods.
    ExactConvergence<K>
    The weight convergence condition that yields true if and only if the previous and current weights are equal according to the weight type's equal(Object) method.
    ExplicitAutomaton<L,K>
    Subclasses of this abstract class implement automaton types that explicitly store information of states (initial weight, final weight, incoming/outgoing transitions) and transitions (previous/next state, label, weight).
    HashAutomaton<L,K>
    Implementation of Automaton that is backed up by HashMaps that contain information of states and transitions.
    HashMTLabel<T,L>
    Implementation of a multi-tape label type.
    HashTransducer<I,O,K>
    Implementation of Automaton that is backed up by HashMaps that contain information of states and transitions.
    IntegerComparator
    A Comparator for the natural order of Integer.
    MTAutomata
    Class with static methods to perform operations on multi-tape automata.
    Path<L,K>
    Instances of this class contain a path, its label and its weight.
    SingleSourceShortestDistances<K>
    This class implements the generic single-source shortest distance algorithm described by [1].
    SingleStringAutomaton<L,K>
    An automaton type that only accepts a single specified string.
    TLabel<I,O>
    Implements an input/output label pair for transducers.
    Transducers
    This class contains static methods for finite state transducers.
